name: Chu Ros Thai NYC
address: Chu Ros Thai Restaurant, 1590 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA

reviews.text: Just plain delicious! And full of flavor!
Good food. Nice atmosphere. Chill.
Visited this restaurant which is next to Museum of the city of New York. Serve is fast, the crab is fresh.
Food was super yummy!! Seafood was perfect
Excellent food and place.
Best thai food ive had in a while very good omg not even exaggerating a must try.
Hicimos el menÃº de mediodÃ­a y muy bueno! Recomendable
Had the soft shell crab curry, masamun curry and pork chop. They were all delicious! Highly recommend
Great food! Nice interior and very authentic tasting food
Had the soft shell crab curry and it was delicious!

Food Is Amazing ğŸ©·ğŸ˜
Best food, best service
I live around the corner and LOVE this place! Thereâ€™s no wrong choice, everything is delicious!
Delicious Food
Loved the basil fried rice and can never go wrong with the thai iced tea!
Great spot! Excellent spot for authentic Thai cuisine.
Best option to  go near to central park. Gluten  free options. Just delicious.
I had one of the best Thai food ever. I ordered the dried red chilli sauce and it was amazing! Definitely coming back. Also it was very affordable for the quality food that you get.
Incredible service and wonderful food!
The portions were great and the red curry was FANTASTIC

I visited this restaurant with a friend and was instantly impressed by its beautiful, welcoming atmosphere. It was a crisp, sunny day, so we loved that the restaurant had an open-space concept; perfect for enjoying the weather. The food and drinks were absolutely amazing; everything exceeded our expectations, and Iâ€™d definitely come back again!

We had the chicken satay (so flavorful!), pineapple fried rice with chicken, and some crispy French fries all so good. The drinks were also fantastic; we tried a few and loved every single one.
There are two more things not added to the description but i did take pictures of them/ ones beef and ones chicken all of the sauces provided were devine.
The food was so flavorful, I would definitely come back for more. The beef in cashew nut sauce was sooo good.
This my second time here & I must say itâ€™s just as tasty as I remember. Ambiance is 10 out of 10. Always a pleasure to come back.
Sono sapori molto buoni, molto consigliato. La zona non Ã¨ la migliore perÃ²...

First I got the cancer â€”coffee or me . It has coffee beans in it. At first I wasnâ€™t too sure about it but the bitterness from the coffee mixed with the sweetness and then the nice smell of cinnamon made it nice.

Then the appetizer came out. I ordered the five star Thai dumplings . Steamed ground chicken and shrimp dumpling. Served with soy vinaigrette sauce. The dumplings were soft but had texture and had weight too it. The soy vinaigrette was sweet and thick which I liked.

Lastly , I got the basil sauce . With chicken, mixed veggies ( onions, sweet red pepper, green pepper, orange pepper and some basil) with a side of jasmine rice. Eventhough I asked for it to be made spicy, It wasnâ€™t too spicy.
Beautiful atmosphere!! I came for my birthday and everyone is so nice !!
Beautiful atmosphere, attentive service, and absolutely delicious food
Nice place, delicious food!
Great place, we get take out from here all the time!!
Love this place! Amazing every time!
My favorite Thai place in the neighborhood. The lunch deal is really affordable, and the they're really fast if you're on a time crunch!
good place!
Very nice place. Staff was pleasant and accommodating. I enjoyed the decor and i ndoor/outdoor seating.

My sister and I stopped by for a quick dinner while waiting for our mom, who was having surgery at the nearby hospital. We were worried and hungry, and came across this local Thai restaurant with many good reviews. We decided to try it, and it turned out to be such a wonderful experience.

The food was absolutely delicious and authentic, the service was warm and attentive, and the background music was gentle and calmingâ€”just what we needed to ease our anxious hearts. By the end of our meal, we received a call from the surgeon telling us that our momâ€™s surgery was a great success.

This dinner brought comfort and joy to us on such a stressful day. I would love to come back again when I get the chance.

Highly recommendedâ€”authentic, tasty Thai food and excellent service!
Beautiful place!

Beautiful, cozy restaurant. So lovely to sit inside because they open the front entirely. Lovely cutlery and plates, and food was delicious. Beautiful presentation. Highly recommend the crab fried rice.
Great service, amazing food!
Great restaurant with nice nice tea!
Service was great. Came really early and they were nice to accommodate us.
The best crab rangoon ever!!

THE best Thai food Iâ€™ve had since being in NYC and Brooklyn! Pad Kee Mao is so delicious and flavorful. Food is consistently good and very reasonably priced. I wish I still lived down the street from here but I definitely visit whenever Iâ€™m in the area!

Really excellent Thai cuisine
Very fresh and innovative dishes and ingredients
One of my favorite places now. Have been coming back here when in this area, and got in for a lunch today - noodles and crab rangoon were amazing. Love their thai iced green tea.
I have a New Yorker friend that introduced me to this place. The food and the service is amazing.
Discovered this hidden spot in upper east side when visiting for the weekend and it was great! Delicious food. Wonderful service. And great lunch deal.
World class. The ratings represent the quality of the food and deep flavors. 5 â­ï¸
We've  been here several  times and the good and service is always top notch!!!!
The food was excelent, its our third time and we will back again!!
Dining at Chu Ros Thai NYC is a delight â€” every visit feels like an authentic culinary journey back to Thailand. ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ˜‹

A great little Thai spot with good dishes. The pad Thai was good, nicely seasoned and satisfying. The Khao soi was excellent, and stood out. The prices were slightly high at normal price, so the lunch special would be great. Around $17 a dish, so above average. The cocktails were good, but the margarita a touch sweet and the michelada was just a normal Michelada. This is a solid spot if youâ€™re in a pinch, and I will come back for the lunch special menu.

One of the hidden gem restaurants in NY city, Cozy and lovely atmosphere , friendly service .
The food very delicious , hot and very tasty.
Vegetarian spring roll was hot and yummy.
Chicken wings so crispy.
Thai curry with chicken and rice with rich flavour.
Seating area so beautiful and clean.

Fantastic pre-theater discovery in East Harlem â€” Chu Ros Thai: great selection, tasty, authentic, generous, reasonable, quick, friendly, and a beautiful space.

To support this, here are our duck selections â€” basil and sriracha over flat noodles. Honestly, the variety of duck options here is like I have never seen before and we have two duck aficionados in the family.

There were also green curry, obligatory papaya salad and tom yum. With all that, the most memorable selection among us carnivores was a vegetarian entree called Eggplantâ€™s Garden â€” the texture and mildly spicy sweet sauce are not to be missed.

Our carefully boxed leftovers lasted two more lunches.

Walking into Chu Ros Thai is like discovering one of the cityâ€™s best kept Thai secrets. The cozy restaurant serves up bold and rich authentic Thai flavors with many excellent cocktails and drink choices. Itâ€™s straight up Thai soul food with utmost Thai hospitality. Perfect for date night, dinner, or even a solo recharge spot when you need a reset. Portions are generous and prices are very reasonable in this clean restaurant. Craving Thai by the Upper East Side? Look no further. Chu Ros Thai is right there.

This place is beautifully decorated. The front window opens up to the street giving it a cool vibe.  The food was amazing. Some of the best Thai food Iâ€™ve had. I tried the mango sticky rice for the first time and it was also amazing. The hosts are very friendly and responsive.

Delicious Thai Food in NYC - A Must-Visit Spot!

This was my second time dining at Chu Ros Thai, and it was just as amazing as the first! Every time I visit New York, I make sure to stop by. This time, I tried the Hot Pot Tom Yum Talay, and it was absolutely deliciousâ€”packed with bold, flavorful broth and fresh seafood. My brother swears by their Drunken Noodles, and I can see why!

The service was excellent, and the drinks were great too. The only thing to note is that itâ€™s a bit pricey, our meal for two came to over $133 with tip for just 2 entres an appetizer and 2 drinks, so itâ€™s something to consider if you're on a budget. That said, with rising prices everywhere, itâ€™s understandable, and the quality makes it worth it.

Overall, Iâ€™d give this place 4.5 stars fantastic food, great service, and a solid choice for Thai cuisine in NYC. Highly recommend!

If you're craving incredible Thai food, you need to check out Churo Thai on the UES.
Itâ€™s a cozy spot with a huge selection of fresh, delicious dishes â€” everything we tried was packed with flavor!
The Tom Yum Soup was super flavorful, the Curry Khao Soi was absolutely delicious, and the cocktails? Next level.
The decor is vibrant and full of beautiful flowers, and the staff couldnâ€™t have been more friendly.
Service was amazing from start to finish.
Definitely my favorite hidden gem in the city!

Flavor was amazing!
We had the crab Rangoon, shrimp and chicken dumplings, pad Thai & drunken noodles! Limoncello cake sooo good! Everything was a hit!
Flavor was potent!

One of the best Thai spots Iâ€™ve ever been to!
I stumbled upon this place by chance and Iâ€™m so glad I did. Lunch special totally worth it.

The spring rolls were absolutely amazing, and the green curry was rich and flavorful ,just a bit salty for my taste, but still delicious.
Highly recommend!

Loved this place! Warm and cozy; friendly atmosphere; attentive service. Great food. Clean and peaceful dining. Fast service. Enjoyed the Pad Thai with Tofu very much. Nice selection of food and drinks. Will definitely return.

Just ate here. Food was good. I had to take one star off. I order appetizers five minutes later the server came back and took my main order. A few minutes later she came and dropped off my appetizers and main meal at the same time.
Pad see ew was good, appetizers sampler was ok, mago sticky rice was ok, my mix drink was ok I didn't taste any liquor. Since the appetizers and dessert and drink was only ok cause me to give them 4 stars. Would I come back here. Yes I would. The food was good. I would not drive out my way to go here.

Visited here today in Harlem and the restaurant is very beautiful and cozy. My server was very kind, I did not get his name but he was attentive and everything came out pretty quickly. The food was amazinggg, portion sizes were great andâ€¦

Dining here was an awesome experience. I love Pad Thai and this place made it absolutely perfect. The sticky rice with mango for dessert was just heavenly. Highly recommended. Another fun aspect is they change the decor twice a year to follow the seasons, so itâ€™s always looking a little different depending on when you visit.
I was here with my homegirl. It was my first time having Thai food. It was pretty good. I just didn't like sticky lychee rice

I had an absolutely fantastic experience at the restaurant! The service was exceptional, and I felt genuinely valued when they inquired about my allergies. I tried the Duck Tamarind, and although I couldnâ€™t finish it due to being so full, the tender duck with its crispy skin was absolutely delightful. I wholeheartedly recommend the Honey Roasted Duck; it was nothing short of incredible! This was my first visit, but it definitely wonâ€™t be my last. Plus, the prices were surprisingly reasonable for such a five-star experience. Hereâ€™s to many more delicious meals ahead! Cheers! ğŸ‰

This my favorite Thai place in Manhattan. Fast service and delicious food. The picture shows our green papaya salad. Unfortunately, we were too excited to eat and I forgot to take a picture of our basil fried rice and pad Thai. I recommend a lychee martini, as well. The atmosphere is nice especially on a summer evening when they open the large windows.

Needed some food after touring THE FRICK, the food and drink were really good!
I know I will visit some of the museums nearby again soon and will make this our before or after food spot..
One of the best Thai spots in NYC. I've been here 3 times so far and it blows a lot of the famous Thai spots in Brooklyn out of the water. Highly recommend this spot.

Wow, terrible service.  I have never experienced such a rude staff. Wow, They have good ratings because the policy of giving a free drink for a 5 star rating. Food was okay, average at best.  I did like the chicken wings.

Again, rude people.

The guy next to me was truly upset. Too long of a story, but in short very rude staff.  Wow.
Best authentic Thai food ever! Well cocktails drink and good vibes!! Donâ€™t miss it!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ¥°
First time here and was blown away. EVERYTHING was great. They also have a great mocktail menu. Will come again

This is a nice and cozy spot for Thai food. Service is very nice and accommodating, and made sure that everybodyâ€™s dietary restrictions are covered (gluten free + low FODMAP). Options are plenty, and the environment is like a small garden. Didnâ€™t get to try out the bar or the whole day happy hours, definitely will next time in the area.

Ordered the udon drunken noodles and the thai iced tea. Both were excellent in taste and good portions.
This is the place to get Thai food at! The Pad See Ew Noodles with Beef were to die for. The drinks were also phenomenal.

This place is a true gem. The atmosphere is warm and stylish, perfect for a night out or a special occasion. Every dish was flavorful and beautifully presented. Cocktails were creative and perfectly balanced. Service was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable without being overbearing. You can tell thereâ€™s real passion behind everything here. Highly recommendâ€”Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

This place is beautiful, not too crowded, has great drinks and kind staff. The appetizers and food were very good. I will definitely visit again ğŸ˜€ we tried the chicken pad Thai, and it had great flavor. Also tried the fried chicken pad Thai, which had a lighter sauce flavor, but the chicken was great.

Amazing atmosphere and the food is delicious! Servers are always super friendly and attentive. The presentation of each dish is amazing, they go above and beyond! The cocktails are delicious! 1000% recommend!

Basil Thai fried rice was really good! My friend has never had Thai food and really enjoyed his pad Thai.

lunch special is a great value.

In a neighborhood with no shortage of Thai restaurantsâ€”I've tried at least four of themâ€”Chu Ros Thai stands out as something truly special. This place doesnâ€™t just deliver great food; it creates an experience that feels like coming home, no matter who you are or where you're from.

The service here is nothing short of outstanding. From the moment you walk in, youâ€™re treated with genuine warmth and hospitality. The staff goes above and beyond to make sure you feel welcome and well taken care of. It's clear that they take pride in not just the food they serve, but also in creating a space where everyone feels like they belong.

The atmosphere is incredible, with a vibe thatâ€™s both cozy and vibrant. It feels like youâ€™ve stepped out of your house only to find yourself in a place thatâ€™s just as comfortable and inviting. The decor is charming, and the ambiance strikes a perfect balance between casual and elegant.

And then thereâ€™s the foodâ€”absolutely amazing. Chu Ros Thai doesnâ€™t just serve Thai cuisine; they elevate it to a level thatâ€™s hard to match. Every dish is bursting with flavor, prepared with care, and presented beautifully. Whether youâ€™re a fan of spicy curries, fresh salads, or perfectly cooked noodles, youâ€™ll find something here that will keep you coming back for more.

What really sets Chu Ros Thai apart, though, is the way they embrace everyone who walks through their doors. This is a place where all lifestyles are accepted, where thereâ€™s no discrimination, and where everyone is treated like family. Itâ€™s a rare and wonderful thing to find a restaurant that not only feeds your body but also nourishes your soul.

Chu Ros Thai is in a league of its own, and I canâ€™t recommend it highly enough. If youâ€™re in the area, do yourself a favor and experience it for yourself. Youâ€™ll feel like youâ€™ve found a second home.

Thai food ğŸš¨ absolutely gem in New York. Small but absolutely beautiful inside, feel seat in the Thai garden. Yes, absolutely is one of the best Thai restaurant ever with friendly service.

They offer so many variety choose of food and cocktails ğŸ¹ They have amazing happy hour everyday until 7pm with valuable price.

â€¼ï¸Monday - Friday lunch special 11am - 3:00pm. We got our food within 10 minutes of ordering. OMG! Itâ€™s was really fast and nice to people who only have 1.5h lunch break.

âœ¨Mixed Appetizer
âœ¨Creamy Hot Pot TomYum Talay
âœ¨Khao Soi Chicken
âœ¨Crab Meat Fired Rice

Creamy Hot Pot TomYum Talay ğŸ² with Salmon, Shrimp, New Zealsnd Mussels and other veggies. Fresh, Tasty, Flavorful.

So surprised! The decoration of the restaurant will change on winter ğŸ¥¶ summer ğŸŒ

I had an incredible dining experience at this Thai restaurant in East Harlem! From the moment I walked in, the warm and welcoming atmosphere made me feel right at home. The Tom Yum soup was bursting with fresh, tangy flavors, and the perfect balance of spice really brought out its authentic taste. The beef fried rice was equally deliciousâ€”tender, savory, and beautifully seasoned. I also appreciated the generous portions and the attentive, friendly service from the staff. If youâ€™re looking for top-notch Thai cuisine in a relaxed setting, this place is an absolute must-visit!

Great Thai restaurant in the area. The service is awesome and very nice people, excellent prices for the food. The decor is amazing for both winter and summer. I do recommend Chu Ros Thai to anyone who comes into the neighborhood.

Great restaurant for lunch & dinner! I recently was in the area and decided to pop in for lunch. This restaurant is small but absolutely beautiful inside, very aesthetically pleasing. When I sat down, I was greeted right away and provided with the menus. Chu Ros offers many different food options and cocktails & they have an amazing happy hour. I highly recommend the panang curry and pineapple fried rice, absolutely delicious!
The ambiance and the food and drinks is absolutely amazing. I love it here... it's so cozy and the staff is always so friendly. 100 / 100

Came here for a late weekend brunch. The floor to ceiling windows were kept opened and a ray of sunshine was beaming into the cozy restaurant.  Appreciated the decor inside that gave it a pop vibe to the place. we tried the shrimp mango salad and pork chop. The pork chop was excellent with four to five slices of charred pork with steamed veggies and rice.  The salad was also tasty with ample shrimp but I shouldâ€™ve ordered with the sweet chilli dressing on the side, as it was a little too saucy for me. Will come back to try their other dishes!
It was delicious and such a beautiful little place. The service was good and quick. We got out food pretty fast. The chicken pad thai was my favorite.

After a long day of travel and sight-seeing, this place hit the spot! Absolutely delicious Thai cuisine that delivered on every expectation I didn't know was even hoping for.

The Thai tea was fresh made and heavy on the sweeten condensed milk. The Appetizer plate was hot, fresh, and the perfect mix of starters covering that American-Asian familiarity. By far the best part of the meal was the Pad Kea Mao. Perfectly cooked with the right amount of crisp in the protein and veggies while still maintaining the springy bounce of the noodles. The dish as a whole was generous with the sauce so every bite was perfectly dressed. Despite my impressions of how much sauce was used, there was none to be found at the bottom of my plate. Perfect.

Would highly recommend this spot to anyone in the area looking for some high-quality food in a vibrant, modern setting.

Pretty good Thai food, definitely more on the no frills side for Manhattan Thai places. Is it as authentic as you can get? No itâ€™s not, but itâ€™s still good for a more local neighborhood Thai place. I like that offer a variety of protein (vegetarian and vegan friendly). I donâ€™t have any dietary restrictions myself but I appreciate their range. I got the mock duck basil over rice lunch special, portion was fair and it even came with gyozas as a small app. The basil sauce was too sweet in my opinion. I would definitely come back if Iâ€™m in the area but I wouldnâ€™t travel out of my way to eat here.
